page.title: 15LANDSCAPE
page.content: The natural appearance would have been of gently rolling, wooded slopes, covering coal measures, with natural drainage towards the River Mersey to the south-east. However,man has had a dramatic impact. There is{farming}mainly evident north of the East Lancs Road and Carr Mill Dam, a man-made water. The housing was originally linear along West End Road and Clipsley Lane, which grew up as a now extinct mining community. Since then{housing}has sprawled and spread between the man-made barriers of the East Lancs Road and the line of the old Sankey Canal.{Eyesores}are common, with derelict houses and land, {industrial development}and a mining spoil/rubbish tip which is now being remodelled as a golf course.
